image.altText: two police investigators standing at the scene of a crash

items.synopsis: The man's death is the 79th life lost on South Australia's roads this year, compared with 52 at the same time last year.

title.children: Motorcyclist killed after collision with ute in Adelaide Hills

image.altText: A close-up of the side of an ambulance

items.synopsis: Ramping is on the rise again in South Australia, with more than 10,000 hours lost while ambulances waited outside the state's major hospitals during winter.

title.children: Latest data shows ramping continues to rise outside SA's emergency departments

image.altText: A man was caught riding a scissorlift

items.synopsis: An Adelaide man is charged with riding a stolen scissor lift down a popular Adelaide party strip.

title.children: Man charged after allegedly driving stolen scissor lift down Adelaide party street

image.altText: A vertical image of a an airport lounge, with brown leather seats, green counters, and wood accents.

items.synopsis: It’s tucked away in six of Australia’s airports, well hidden from the average traveller. Inside, some of Australia’s most powerful enjoy five-star food and wine as they await their flights. But when you ask about the Chairman’s Lounge, Qantas has no comment.

title.children: ‘We don’t comment on the Chairman’s Lounge’: What Qantas won’t tell you about their most exclusive club

image.altText: Five women standing in front of a wall, smiling at the camera

items.synopsis: In a world of diet pills and calorie counting, these women are doing things differently. And, while this Fat Camp is mainly about having fun, there's a serious side, too.

title.children: How a humiliating experience in Bali inspired Annette to set up her own tourism group, 'Fat Camp'

image.altText: An old white man holding a photo of his dead wife. He is sitting on a couch

items.synopsis: Since his partner's death, John's been locked in a lengthy battle with one of Australia's largest funds to get her super paid out. He's not alone, with the country's peak advocacy group calling for an end to lengthy delays and further grief for families.

title.children: Superannuation payout delays throw spotlight on 'harrowing' ordeal for families

image.altText: A grey Mazda vehicle crashed into a pole.

items.synopsis: Police insist Melbourne is safe after a terrifying CBD incident that claimed a life and injured others and a crime figure was gunned down in broad daylight.

title.children: Man charged with murder over Melbourne CBD incident, police hunt gunmen over separate shooting

image.altText: A woman's hands holding a yellow menstrual cup and a pink menstrual cup

items.synopsis: Working out how much blood you're losing and getting a sense of when it's outside the normal range can be difficult. But recent research on the capacity of different period products could help, write Phoebe Holdensen Kimura and Bianca Cannon.

title.children: How much period blood is 'normal'? And which sanitary product suits your flow best?

image.altText: Victoria Police logo

items.synopsis: Police say a 15-year-old boy was arrested yesterday and has been charged with numerous offences related to the abduction of a 14-year-old boy in Glen Huntly on Monday.

title.children: Second teen charged over the abduction of boy in Melbourne's south-east

image.altText: news presenter juanita philliips stands in front of a screen holding papers about to read the news

items.synopsis: For the past 21 years, when the cameras start rolling Juanita Phillips has felt at ease. Tonight, she will present the 7pm news bulletin to New South Wales one last time.

title.children: From Bali bombings to Trump win: Juanita Phillips has seen it all as she prepares for last day at ABC

image.altText: A grey Mazda vehicle crashed into a pole.

items.synopsis: Victoria Police say a 26-year-old Melton West man faces multiple charges over a fatal incident on Bourke St.

title.children: Man charged with murder over deadly Melbourne CBD incident

image.altText: Crime figure Gavin Preston looks unsmilingly into the camera as he poses for a photo.

items.synopsis: A Melbourne underworld figure has been killed and another man has been critically injured in what police have described as an organised crime shooting outside a cafe in the city's north-west.

title.children: Gunmen still at large after Melbourne underworld figure shot dead outside cafe

image.altText: A man stands in the doorway of a collapsed building in front of him, with rubble everywhere

items.synopsis: The epicentre in the High Atlas Mountains, known as Ighil, is in a region of small farming villages about 70km from the city of Marrakesh.

title.children: 'If one falls, it will cause others to collapse': Hundreds stranded in Morocco as earthquake death toll rises to over 2000

image.altText: A small brown brick house

items.synopsis: A house vacant for years has put South Australia's police minister in a tough position — either allow it to be rented to public servants, besides police officers, or admit that the town's police station will never reopen.

title.children: There's a housing crisis in this region but police leave this home vacant

image.altText: Hunter Biden, dressed in a suit, is seen outside.

items.synopsis: Hunter Biden's lived a life of troubles and tragedies. While a prosecutor prepares to have him charged, Republicans keep digging into his history as they call for an impeachment inquiry into his president father.

title.children: Family tragedy, leaked nudes and a crack addiction: Hunter Biden can't escape his past

image.altText: Pareto phone graphic

items.synopsis: The ABC can reveal former staff of hacked tele-fundraiser Pareto Phone were not told for weeks that their highly sensitive employment information was published on the dark web.

title.children: Pareto Phone workers not told criminal checks among 320,000 files published in hack

image.altText: qld premier annastacia palaszczuk and prime minister anthony albanese stand on a stage at a conference

items.synopsis: Acting Premier Steven Miles dismissed concerns about Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk's leadership and said it was an "honour" to serve as deputy in the wake of gloomy polling.

title.children: Latest poll 'undeniably bad news' for Palaszczuk and Queensland Labor

image.altText: A shipwreck underwater shot from above, very close to the shoreline in Solomon Islands.

items.synopsis: An estimated 3,800 ships were sunk during the conflict and remain on the Pacific Ocean floor. Many carried thousands of tonnes of oil and unknown quantities of unexploded bombs. As they rust through, experts fear a detrimental impact on the marine environment and local livelihoods.

title.children: 'We were not responsible': Pacific Islanders call on WWII combatants to decontaminate rusting shipwrecks

image.altText: Taniela Tupou passes the ball

items.synopsis: Taniela Tupou pulls out an outlandish offload and surprise pick Ben Donaldson stars with two tries in a man-of-the-match performance. Here are the five things you missed from the Wallabies Rugby World Cup victory against Georgia overnight.

title.children: Five quick hits — A magic prop and an 'unreal' fullback help Wallabies to World Cup victory

image.altText: Three male rugby league players embrace after winning a game of football, wearing red, white and blue shirts

items.synopsis: Despite losing several key men to injury and ill-discipline, the Roosters score an incredible finals win over Cronulla in the Shire.

title.children: 'It got really wild': Sin-bins, injuries and last-gasp heroics as Roosters end Cronulla's NRL season

image.altText: Brisbane Lions forward Charlie Cameron sprints away from goal, with his finger pointed in celebration as the crowd cheers.

items.synopsis: Brisbane Lions produce a brilliant attacking display to move through to another home prelim, downing Port Adelaide at the Gabba with the help of 200-gamer Charlie Cameron.

title.children: Lions rampant as home side tears Power apart on way to a home prelim

image.altText: Flames on the roof of a house

items.synopsis: South Australian fire crews attend three separate house fires, with a house on Gilbert Street in the city extensively damaged, along with a home in Brooklyn Park, while a house at Port Vincent is also completely destroyed.

title.children: Suspicious fire engulfs city house, causing heavy smoke and traffic restrictions

image.altText: Narendra Modi sits at a table at the G20.

items.synopsis: World leaders have called for the upholding of international law including territorial sovereignty, while failing to condemn the war in Ukraine, after concerns there would not be an agreement for the first time in the summit's history.

title.children: G20 leaders make joint declaration but concede on Ukraine war condemnation

image.altText: Three Wallabies players celebrate a try against Georgia.

items.synopsis: Eddie Jones and the Wallabies know they have bigger fish to fry at the Rugby World Cup in France, but they deserve to take confidence from their opening win over Georgia, writes Luke Pentony.

title.children: Losing had become a habit for the Wallabies, which is why their World Cup win over Georgia was crucial

image.altText: Daniel Khalife wanted sign

items.synopsis: A former British soldier suspected of terrorism offences who escaped from prison is recaptured in London.

title.children: UK police catch terrorism suspect who escaped from London prison

image.altText: A woman with dark brown hair sleeping in a bed, made in white linen, next to a gold alarm clock on a bedside table

items.synopsis: Dreams keep our brains ticking over. They wash the thoughts from the day's events at a molecular level. They might even help us imagine what's possible during our waking hours, write Drew Dawson and Madeline Sprajcer.

title.children: The science of dreams and nightmares: What is going on in our brains while we're sleeping?

image.altText: A team celebrates after scoring a try in a rugby league match

items.synopsis: It happened again, the same way it always does, and Penrith are heading to the NRL preliminary final again, the same way they seemingly always do, after an easy win over the Warriors.

title.children: Penrith's brutal finals win over the Warriors is the newest chapter in the same old story

image.altText: A Giants AFL player jumps in the air in celebration as a smiling teammate points at him after a goal.

items.synopsis: The Giants are into a cut-throat semifinal after an impressive elimination final performance that ends St Kilda's season.

title.children: Giants make a big, big sound at the MCG to end St Kilda's season

image.altText: A Wallabies player holds the ball with his left hand as he runs away to score a try at the Rugby World Cup.

items.synopsis: After five consecutive Test losses under coach Eddie Jones this year, the Wallabies break through for a vital 35-15 win over Georgia at Stade de France in Paris.

title.children: Wallabies defeat Georgia to open Rugby World Cup campaign on positive note

image.altText: Unidentified woman in foreground holding black and white holding ultrasound of baby scan with blue line around the scan

items.synopsis: An Australian woman caught up in a surrogacy scandal in Greece has spoken about her emotional ordeal as she desperately fights to be allowed to keep her baby.

title.children: Sarah has a baby due in October. She fears she may never get to meet it

image.altText: A group of girls walking up a street with a megaphone.

items.synopsis: A spokesperson says the company is investigating workers' concerns. However, staff say there is still confusion about how much they should be paid.

title.children: Mint My Desk staff walk off job for second time over alleged underpayment

image.altText: A man in suit looking up at the camera

items.synopsis: Current and past employees spoke up about the bullying and mistreatment they faced while working for the famous US TV host.

title.children: 'It's embarrassing': Jimmy Fallon apologises to The Tonight Show staff for toxic work culture

image.altText: Catherine King stands at lecturn in front of airport signage

items.synopsis: The government's Qatar decision isn't just about preventing Australians from accessing more flights at cheaper prices, but about the binfire that is our national carrier and its multiple failures to treat its staff and customers with respect, writes Laura Tingle.

title.children: The underlying problem behind the Qantas binfire

image.altText: a large aboriginal flag flying above a large group of people at a city march

items.synopsis: The latest poll result for the Voice referendum shows more bad news for Yes with rapidly declining support across all demographics. For Yes to win from here it needs to turn things around fast and undecided voters are in the spotlight, writes Casey Briggs.

title.children: Uninformed, bored and apathetic: Voters are turning against the Voice in the polls

image.altText: Photo of older man with glasses DJing.

items.synopsis: Simon Zaicz went from tour-managing rock bands like Split Enz and Australian Crawl to become Pa to a legion of bush doofers.

title.children: 'Godfather' of doof trance DJ pushing 70 and still a weapon on the festival stage
